# NSMenuItemBadge.BadgeType

**Enumeration**

Constants that define types of badges for display.

## Declaration

```swift
enum BadgeType
```

## Overview

The predefined strings that display are localizable and automatically handle any pluralization of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuItemBadge/itemCount].

## Getting badge types

- **NSMenuItemBadge.BadgeType.alerts**: A badge representing the number of alerts.
- **NSMenuItemBadge.BadgeType.newItems**: A badge representing the number of new items.
- **NSMenuItemBadge.BadgeType.none**: A badge with no string portion.
- **NSMenuItemBadge.BadgeType.updates**: A badge representing the number of available updates.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Creating badges of a specific type

- **alerts(count:)**: Creates an alert-style badge with an integer count and a predefined label that represents the number of alerts.
- **newItems(count:)**: Creates a new item-style badge with an integer count and a predefined label that represents the number of new items.
- **updates(count:)**: Creates an update-style badge with an integer count and a predefined label that represents the number of available updates.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
